knimeNode.name: Polynomial Regression Learner
knimeNode.shortDescription: Learner that builds a polynomial regression model from the input data

fullDescription.intro: This node performs polynomial regression on the input data and computes the coefficients that minimize the squared error. The user must choose which of the input columns is the target or dependent variable. By default, polynomial with degree 2 are used, which can be changed in the dialog.
fullDescription.option: The column that contains the dependent "target" variable.
The maximum degree the polynomial regression function should have.
Select the columns containing the independent variables and move them to the "include" list.

ports.dataIn: The input samples, only numeric columns are allowed and except that target column all are used for regression. The input must not contain missing values, you have to fix them by e.g. using the Missing Values node.
ports.dataOut: Training data classified with the learned model and the corresponding errors.
ports.modelOut: The computed regression coefficients as a model for use in the Polynomial Regression Predictor.

views.view: Shows all learned coefficients all attributes.
Shows the data points and the regression function in one dimension.
